subject: Negotiation
title: Creating Competition for Your Offer
description: A fast breakdown of Creating Competition for Your Offer for builders.

hook.text: One buyer means they set the price. Three buyers means you set the price. Competition creates leverage.

buildup.text: When multiple parties want what you have, they bid against each other instead of bargaining against you.

discovery.text: Even the perception of competition shifts power. 'We're talking to other firms' changes the entire dynamic.

twist.text: You don't need actual competing offers â€” but having them is infinitely more powerful than bluffing.

climax.text: Before negotiating, create genuine alternatives. Let the other side know they're not your only option.

punchline.text: Options are leverage. More options means more power.

quiz.question: How does competition create leverage?
options: Multiple interested parties bid against each other, raising your power
Competition always leads to worse deals
